文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: Zirconium alloys are susceptible to a stable cracking process called delayed hydride cracking (DHC).

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: DHC properties were measured on a number of components, made from the two-phase alloy $z _ { \mathrm { r } - 2 . 5 \mathrm { N b } }$ , irradiated at temperatures in the range of 250 to $2 9 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ in fast neutron fluxes $( E \ge 1 \ \mathbf { M e V } )$ between $1 . 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 }$ and $1 . 8 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 8 } \mathrm { { n / m ^ { 2 } \cdot s } }$ to fluences between $0 . 0 1 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 }$ and $9 . 8 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \mathrm { n } / \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 }$

证据片段: The neutron irradiation reduced $K _ { I H }$ by about $20 \%$

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: The increase in crack velocity was greatest with the lowest irradiation temperature.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: X-ray diffraction analyses showed that the degree of $\beta$ -phase decomposition was highest with an irradiation temperature of ${ \bf 2 9 0 ^ { \circ } C }$

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: Pressure tubes in CANDU reactors are made from $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } \mathbf { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ alloy by hot extrusion of hollow billets followed by $25 \%$ cold work.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk1
证据片段: The extrusion process results in a crystallographic texture with the following resolved basal pole fractions: 0.32 (radial), 0.61 (transverse), and 0.07 (axial).

证据片段: We_estimate the error in measuring $K _ { I H }$ , using the load reducing method, to be $\pm 1$ $\mathbf { M P a } \sqrt { \mathbf { m } } ~ ( \pm 1 5 \% )$

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk2
证据片段: The microstructure of cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb consists of flat, $\pmb { \alpha }$ -zirconium grains surrounded by thin layers of continuous $\beta$ zirconium

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk3
证据片段: In the R/J region, the crack velocity increased rapidly with fluence, Figs. 5 and 6.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk3
证据片段: The results from the end-of-life irradiations (TRILLIUM and ERABLE) showed a weak dependence of the crack velocity on fluence, Fig. 6.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk3
证据片段: In specimens from the main bodies of pressure tubes, the crack velocity was three to five times higher than that of unirradiated material and was found to be independent of fluence, Figs. 5 and 6.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk3
证据片段: The yield stress follows a similar behavior, Fig. 7 [11]; it saturates at about $0 . 3 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \mathrm { n } / \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 }$ .

证据片段: Shapes of cracks in early Pickering and Bruce reactors indicated that the rate of crack growth in the axial direction of the tube is about twice that in the radial direction.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_007_chunk8
证据片段: The original hydrides in this material are oriented parallel to the circumferential-axial plane along the α/β phase boundaries.

证据片段: The precipitation of hydrides in the hexagonal α-phase is known to occur on habit planes that are very close to the basal planes.
